article.simpara: Hue, http://gethue.com, is an open source Web UI for easily doing Big Data analysis with Hadoop.

listitem.simpara: Editors for Hive, Impala and Pig for either batch and interactive SQL
Search Dashboards for querying, exploring, visualizing data and with Solr
Hadoop File, Job and HBase Browsers

article.simpara: On top of that, a SDK is available for creating new apps integrated with Hadoop.
More user and developer documentation is available at http://gethue.com.

section.title: Latest Notable Features
section.simpara: The complete list and video demos are on http://gethue.com/hue-3-7-with-sentry-app-and-new-search-widgets-are-out/.

listitem.simpara: New Sentry App
Bulk edit roles and privileges
Visualize/edit roles and privileges on a database tree
WITH GRANT OPTION support
Impersonate a user to see which databases and table he can see
Three new widgets
Heatmap
Tree
Marker Map
Field Analysis
Exclude Facets
Bulk suspend/kill/resume actions on dashboards
Faster dashboards
Rerun failed coordinator instances in bulk
Kill application button for YARN
ACLs Edition
Drag & Drop upload
Navigation History
Simpler interface
Kerberos support. Next step will be impersonation!
LDAP passthrough
SSL encryption with HiveServer2
New graphs
Automatic query timeout

section.title: Compatibility
section.simpara: Runs on CentOS versions 5 to 6, Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL 5 and 6), and Ubuntu 10.04, 12:04 and 14.04.

listitem.simpara: Hive 0.13.1
Oozie 4.0
HBase 0.98.6
Pig 0.12
Impala 1.3
Solr 4.4
Sqoop2 1.99.3

section.simpara: These minimum versions should work (not tested):

listitem.simpara: Hive 0.12.0
Oozie 3.2
HBase 0.92
Pig 0.8
Impala 1.0
Solr 3.6
Sqoop2 1.99.3
Windows: Chrome, Firefox 3.6+, Internet Explorer 9+, Safari 5+
Linux : Chrome, Firefox 3.6+
Mac: Chrome, Firefox 3.6+, Safari 5+

section.simpara: Note: CentOS 5 and RHEL 5 requires EPEL python 2.6 package.
